text:
-
	Axioms of Kaeon
-
	-
		Philosophy
	-
		-
			The Axioms of Kaeon are the set of concepts that provide the philosophical framework
			which guides the pursuit of a goal through Kaeon.
		-
	-
		Principles
	-
		-
			Axioms
		-
			-
				Aether
			-
				-
					Aether refers to all abstract concepts.
				-
			-
				Core
			-
				-
					The core refers to the elementary principles of the world.
				-
			-
				Cora
			-
				-
					The cora refers to that which is objectively true.
				-
			-
				Angaia
			-
				-
					Angaia, or "the whole world", refers to the collective whole of reality.
				-
			-
				Ongaia
			-
				-
					Ongaia, or "the given world", refers to a given section of reality.
				-
			-
				Taro
			-
				-
					Taro, or "the current state", is the state of the world at the current time.
				-
			-
				Saro
			-
				-
					Saro, or "the proven state", refers to states the world has been in.
				-
			-
				Jaro
			-
				-
					Jaro, or "the dream state", refers to hypothetical states of the world.
				-
			-
				Naro
			-
				-
					Naro, or "the void state", is a hypothetical state in which nothing exists and
					no rules, including the core, apply. It is useful for conducting thought
					experiments, and can be romantically referred to as "that place where time and
					space begin".
				-
			-
				Zaro
			-
				-
					Zaro, or "the bad state", is a state which is at odds with the goal set through
					Kaeon.
				-
			-
				Xyro
			-
				-
					Xyro, or "the good state", is a state which in which the goal set through Kaeon
					has been met. It can be romantically referred to as "that place where time and
					space come to an end".
				-
			-
				Meta
			-
				-
					Meta refers to that which causes change in the world.
				-
			-
				Kae
			-
				-
					Kae, or "way", refers to that which directs change in the world.
				-
			-
				Kaera
			-
				-
					Kaera, or "the other way", means to act in pursuit of a goal that is not among
					the goals pursued through Kaeon.
				-
			-
				Kaeda
			-
				-
					Kaeda, or "the aimless way", means to act without a goal pursued through Kaeon.
				-
			-
				Kaelo
			-
				-
					Kaelo, or "the way down", means to act against a goal pursued through Kaeon.
				-
			-
				Deus
			-
				-
					Deus, or "God", refers to that which is beyond any means of control.
				-
			-
				Asada
			-
				-
					Asada, or "assets", refers to that which is an asset.
				-
			-
				Akada
			-
				-
					Akada, or "knowledge", refers to that which is known.
				-
			-
				Sigma
			-
				-
					Sigma, or "channel", means to take an abstract concept into oneself and become
					an embodiment of it.
				-
title: Axioms of Kaeon
